mainTopic.title: Lipid Lowering Drugs
mainTopic.content_info: The lecture handouts come with a lot of detailed information that is sufficient to cover the whole topic

quizzes.question: What are the major risk factors associated with atherosclerosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Longevity, hypertension, diabetes, dyslipoproteinemia, cigarette smoking
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Diabetes, smoking, and excess caffeine consumption

quizzes.question: What is the function of Lp(a) lipoprotein in relation to atherosclerosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: It inhibits tissue plasminogen activator and increases thrombosis risk
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It enhances the flexibility of arteries
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: It assists in the reduction of blood pressure

quizzes.question: How does chronic bacterial infection contribute to atherosclerosis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: It promotes the inflammation process within arteries

subTopics.title: Transmembrane receptors on mammalian cells, Apolipoproteins, sterols and lipoprotein cycles

quizzes.question: What is the role of the LDL receptor in lipid metabolism?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Regulates cholesterol levels by mediating translocation into the cell
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Directly degrades LDL in the plasma
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Promotes bile acid production from cholesterol
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Inhibits the function of HMG-CoA reductase

quizzes.question: What distinguishes plant sterols from animal sterols?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Sitosterol is the major plant sterol and cholesterol is the major animal sterol
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Cholesterol is the primary sterol in both plants and animals
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Sitosterol is the main sterol found in both plants and animals
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Plant sterols are absorbed more efficiently than animal sterols
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Animal sterols are not essential for human health

quizzes.question: How is HDL involved in cholesterol transport?
quizzes.goodAnswer: It scavenges cholesterol from tissues and transports it to the liver or other sites
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: It directly converts cholesterol into triglycerides
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: It decreases cholesterol absorption in the intestines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It enhances the storage of cholesterol in adipose tissue
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: It prevents cholesterol entry into cells

quizzes.question: What is the primary mechanism of action of statins?
quizzes.goodAnswer: They competitively inhibit HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: They directly increase the excretion of cholesterol in the feces
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: They bind cholesterol in the blood, making it inactive
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: They enhance cholesterol absorption in the intestines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: They activate the LDL receptor directly

quizzes.question: How do bile acid-binding resins lower LDL levels?
quizzes.goodAnswer: By increasing bile acid excretion, which upregulates LDL receptor activity
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: By blocking cholesterol synthesis in the liver
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: By directly binding LDL particles in the blood
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: By reducing triglyceride levels in the plasma

quizzes.question: What is a unique effect of niacin compared to other lipid-lowering agents?
quizzes.goodAnswer: It increases HDL levels while also decreasing Lp(a)
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: It only decreases triglyceride levels significantly
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: It solely focuses on reducing LDL levels
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It primarily targets the synthesis of bile acids
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: It does not affect triglyceride or cholesterol levels

subTopics.title: Investigational treatments of atherosclerosis and non-drug treatment: LDL apheresis

quizzes.question: What is LDL apheresis primarily used for?
quizzes.goodAnswer: Lowering LDL in cases of homozygous LDL receptor deficiency
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Increasing HDL levels in the blood

quizzes.question: What is a major limitation of LDL apheresis?
quizzes.goodAnswer: It is limited by cost and inconvenience
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: It has significant adverse effects on liver function
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: It cannot be used in patients under the age of 50
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It is ineffective in decreasing cholesterol absorption
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: It drastically increases the risk of atherosclerosis progression

quizzes.question: What effect do MTP inhibitors have in investigational treatments?
quizzes.goodAnswer: They inhibit VLDL production and lower cholesterol exit from the liver
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: They increase HDL synthesis in the intestines
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: They directly convert cholesterol into bile acids
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: They enhance triglyceride uptake by adipose tissue
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: They significantly reduce the synthesis of apoB-100
